result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley A Griggs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: May transfer probation to Milwaukee County. Sentence credit of 1 day was granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

No Contact with the victim. Defendant to write a letter of apology to victim and deliver through agent. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ashley A Griggs

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Ashley A Griggs in court with Attorney J Anthony Rosario.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Rosario makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:   WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR  (1 day credit, if revoked)    *transfer allowed to Milwaukee County*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  

____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: victim
____Letter of apology to victim (to go through agent)

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  20 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

**Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations**
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on September 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Ashley A Griggs in court with Attorney J Anthony Rosario.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rosario requests a jury status and jury trial date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ashley A Griggs in court with Attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rosario requests a 30 day adjournment.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with Mary G listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Ashley A Griggs in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
